citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The chacoan peccary was limping on the left rear intermittently during inspection. Initially the limp was pronounced, but
then it was difficult to appreciate when the animal slowed down. The facility had not identified the limp or communicated it
to the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection. Facility must observe animals daily to assess their health and well-
being and communicate timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior and well being to the
attending veterinarian.
Correct by 21 August 23

In the baboon enclosure, the slide door had rust on the door. The surfaces of housing facilities must be constructed in a
manner and made of materials that allow them to be readily cleaned and sanitized, and rusty surfaces are difficult to clean
and sanitize. In the vervet enclosure, the frame of the pass through from indoor to outdoor housing was damaged,
creating a jagged edge that might injure the animals. The surfaces of housing facilities that come in contact with
nonhuman primates must be free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and sanitization and jagged edges
or sharp points that might injure the animals.
Correct by 21 August 2023

In the goat and sheep area, the gate was damaged and the welds had broken, resulting in sharp points. In the wallaby
and cavy area, there was a piece of welded wire fence between the shelter and the fence with a series of sharp points.
Sharp points have the potential to injure the animals and these areas were no longer in good repair. Indoor and outdoor
housing facilities shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by 21 August, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager.
Additional Inspectors:
Ashley Alger n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The chacoan peccary was limping on the left rear intermittently during inspection. Initially the limp was pronounced, but 
then it was difficult to appreciate when the animal slowed down. The facility had not identified the limp or communicated it 
to the attending veterinarian at the time of inspection. Facility must observe animals daily to assess their health and well-
being and communicate timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior and well being to the 
attending veterinarian. 
 
Correct by 21 August 23 
3.75(c)(1) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
In the baboon enclosure, the slide door had rust on the door. The surfaces of housing facilities must be constructed in a 
manner and made of materials that allow them to be readily cleaned and sanitized, and rusty surfaces are difficult to clean 
and sanitize. In the vervet enclosure, the frame of the pass through from indoor to outdoor housing was damaged, 
creating a jagged edge that might injure the animals. The surfaces of housing facilities that come in contact with 
nonhuman primates must be free of excessive rust that prevents the required cleaning and sanitization and jagged edges 
or sharp points that might injure the animals. 
 
Correct by 21 August 2023 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
In the goat and sheep area, the gate was damaged and the welds had broken, resulting in sharp points. In the wallaby 
and cavy area, there was a piece of welded wire fence between the shelter and the fence with a series of sharp points. 
Sharp points have the potential to injure the animals and these areas were no longer in good repair. Indoor and outdoor 
housing facilities shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.

Correct by 21 August, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the manager. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Ashley Alger n
